div1.p: Board Says Caldas Serum Is Failure

div1.head: Newspaper clipping, Havana Post, August 29, 1901
div1.opener:
__________________________________________________
BOARD SAYS CALDAS
SERUM IS FAIL-
URE.
Havana Post
Aug 29.
div1.p:
Spaniard Upon Whom the Serum
Was Tried Declared to Have
Bad Case Yellow Fever.

Major Havard Says Case is Most
Pronounced and That Man
is Dangerously III.

Claims the Man Has Not the Fever and
That His Sickness is of a
Different Nature.

There Will be No More Experiments of
the Kind Made in Havane, Says
Major Havard to Post.

According to the unanimous opinion
of the board which was superintending
the test with the serum of Dr. Caldas,
claimed by the discoverer to be a pre-
ventative of yellow fever, the Spaniard
upon whom the test has been made has
developed a severe case of that disease.

Tuesday the board had practically de-
termined that the man had yellow fever.
In fact they had agreed among them-
selves that this was the case. Yesterday
they met and officially determined that
the man had contracted yellow fever
from the bite of the mosquito, a decision
which so far as the board is concerned
pronounced the vaccine serum of Dr.
Caldas a failure.

Major Havard was seen last night by
a reporter of The Post and said:

“There is no doubt in the minds of the
yellow fever board that the man has
contracted yellow fever and that the
vaccine serum of Dr. Caldas fails to pre-
vent. The opinion on the part of the
board was a unanimous one. I regard
the patient as a very sick man. He may
die. He commenced to vomit this after-
noon. There will be no further test of
this serum, as the board has withdrawn
from the matter”

Dr. Caldas and Dr. Bellenzaghi still de-
clare that the man has not contracted
yellow fever and that a day or two will
fully demonstrate this fact. They gave
out a statement to the press yesterday
afternoon in which they give their rea-
sons for declaring that the man has not
contracted yellow fever.

Dr. Bellenzaghi is the man the to whom the Mexican Gov. gave half of the
reward they have offered for a cure for yellow fever, about a year ago.
He is Dr. Caldas's partner - a Brazilian too. I think.
